metadata.title: CVE-2017-1000433 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
pysaml2 version 4.4.0 and older accept any password when run with pythonoptimizations enabled. This allows attackers to log in as any user withoutknowing their password.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-1000433` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-pysaml2 - 3.0.0-3ubuntu1.16.04.3
python3-pysaml2 - 3.0.0-3ubuntu1.16.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-pysaml2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.0.0-3ubuntu1.16.04.3').
